channel.title: Context Engineering Daily - Prompt Engineering
channel.description: Latest Prompt Engineering news in Context Engineering

item.title: Convergence of Outputs When Two Large Language Models Interact in a Multi-Agentic Setup
item.description: arXiv:2512.06256v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this work, we report what happens when two large language models respond to each other for many turns without any outside input in a multi-agent setup. The setup begins with a short seed sentence. After that, each model reads the other's output and...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> instruction, arxiv, embedding, model, study | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: GENIUS: An Agentic AI Framework for Autonomous Design and Execution of Simulation Protocols
item.description: arXiv:2512.06404v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Predictive atomistic simulations have propelled materials discovery, yet routine setup and debugging still demand computer specialists. This know-how gap limits Integrated Computational Materials Engineering (ICME), where state-of-the-art codes exist ...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> framework, LLM, arxiv, model, prompt | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Context-Engineering - "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy. A frontier, first-principles handbook inspired by Karpathy and 3Blue1Brown for moving beyond prompt engineering to the wider discipline of context design, orchestration, and optimization.
item.description: "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy. item.title: Knowing What's Missing: Assessing Information Sufficiency in Question Answering
item.description: arXiv:2512.06476v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Determining whether a provided context contains sufficient information to answer a question is a critical challenge for building reliable question-answering systems. While simple prompting strategies have shown success on factual questions, they frequ...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> framework, reasoning, arxiv, model, prompt | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 80%</small>
